TEI.2.document_title: Philip Dimmitt to Stephen F Austin, 07-06-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: Philip T. Dimmitt to Austin, July 6, 1825. Has been accused of connection with Andrew Valentine, horse thief.
barker_notes.barker_footnotes: Andrew Valentine, horse thief. See Beramendi to Austin, February 15, 1825
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1145

*div1 type="summary"* *p*Philip T. Dimmitt to Austin, July 6, 1825. Has been accused of connection with Andrew Valentine, horse thief.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Sent Antonia*/location_mentioned*—*date_mentioned n="07-06-1825">6 July 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Sir I am sorry to address you on a subject so degrading and below the Honourable feelings of a gentl- but so unfortunate have I bin as to fall under a Report of Dishonourable reput feeling fulley satisfid that I am able to vindicate and satisfy you and all my *person_mentioned*friends */person_mentioned*on that point which shall not leave a stain on my reputation in the minds of my *person_mentioned*friends */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*acquaintances*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Sir I have Inclosed to you a few certificates which you will be so good to examine and I hope thay will satisfy you, and show to you the malevolence of Men, It appears to me that men are composed of malignancy and malice for at the time I was arrested, The *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*in Person went to avery *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*of Respectability in this Place to inform the *person_mentioned*Inhabitants */person_mentioned*for what I was arrested and the cause, and not for aney acqusition or suspicion in aney manner whatever of being Interested with *person_mentioned*Valentine */person_mentioned*etc*/p*
*p*Sir I am not able to say aney thing more on this subject that could satisfy my mind so much as to now who those persons are one that spook of me, let them Gentl be who thay may, If thay say any thing Derogatory to my reputation thay are *person_mentioned*Liers */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Rogues*/person_mentioned*, and I hold my self responsible for aney assertion that I should insert in this letter Sir I am well aware of your not wishing me evil (?) If any News that has falling into your possession Discratible to my conaction or standing in Society you will confer on me the Favor of inform me How and in what manner you recd it, and I will give you such Authenticated Documents as I hope will satisfy your mind and all my friends and acquaintances*/p*
*p*Sir I was in hopes some day or other of finding myself a *person_mentioned*citizen of your *location_mentioned*coloney*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, but very possible for some informous reports which was afloat against me may have lost me my land Sir I am not Like maney If you are not willing to confer on me Citizen ship in your *location_mentioned*coloney*/location_mentioned*, or you have disposed of my intended land—that is neve[r] to make a coolness between me and yourself I was informed by the *person_mentioned*Baron */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*John Austin*/person_mentioned* you had asign me a *location_mentioned*League of land on the Brassos*/location_mentioned* but time has brought about other appearances and Things unforseen, I remain at your command etc. etc. You will write me and give me your opinion of those certificates etc etc and a short description of your *location_mentioned*coloney */location_mentioned*and the *person_mentioned*Inhabitants */person_mentioned*and thare Progress. Your *person_mentioned*Bror*/person_mentioned*. Has all the News—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*P. Dimmitt*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
